upright.description: The Fool signifies the start of a journey with an open heart and a free spirit. It encourages you to embrace new opportunities and adventures.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Fool warns against impulsive actions and a lack of direction, suggesting the need for caution and thoughtful planning.

upright.description: The Magician represents the power to manifest your desires through resourcefulness and skill, turning ideas into reality.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Magician warns against deceit or misuse of your talents, suggesting that your energies may be scattered or misdirected.

upright.description: The High Priestess symbolizes inner wisdom and the mystery of the subconscious, inviting you to trust your instincts.

reversed.description: Reversed, The High Priestess suggests that you may be ignoring your inner voice or that hidden information is at play.

upright.description: The Empress embodies creativity, nurturing energy, and the bounty of nature, inviting growth and prosperity.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Empress may indicate creative blocks or an overly controlling, smothering influence that stifles growth.

upright.description: The Emperor stands for leadership, order, and a solid structure that brings stability and clear direction.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Emperor warns of excessive control or inflexibility, leading to potential abuse of power and instability.

upright.description: The Hierophant represents traditional values, spiritual guidance, and the wisdom of established institutions.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Hierophant suggests breaking free from rigid traditions and embracing a more unconventional approach.

upright.description: The Lovers card signifies deep emotional connections, love, and the harmonious union of opposites.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Lovers indicates challenges in relationships, miscommunication, or imbalances in emotional connections.

upright.description: The Chariot is a symbol of victory achieved through focus, determination, and the mastery of conflicting forces.

reversed.tags: Lack of control, aggression, scattered energy
reversed.description: Reversed, The Chariot warns of a loss of direction or control, and the potential for reckless or aggressive behavior.

upright.description: Strength represents the power of inner resilience, compassion, and gentle control to overcome obstacles.

reversed.description: Reversed, Strength may indicate inner turmoil, self-doubt, or a lack of confidence in facing challenges.

upright.description: The Hermit encourages introspection and solitude to seek inner guidance and a deeper understanding of life.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Hermit can signal excessive isolation or a reluctance to seek support when needed.

upright.description: The Wheel of Fortune reflects the ever-changing cycles of life, bringing opportunities and unexpected turns.

reversed.tags: Bad luck, resistance to change, unpredictability
reversed.description: Reversed, the Wheel of Fortune suggests setbacks, a resistance to change, or unforeseen obstacles.

upright.description: Justice stands for fairness, balance, and the impartial application of truth and legal standards.

reversed.description: Reversed, Justice warns of unfairness, bias, or a distortion of truth that upsets the natural balance.

upright.description: The Hanged Man suggests a time for pause and reflection, inviting you to surrender old habits to see things anew.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Hanged Man indicates difficulty in letting go, which may lead to stagnation or self-sacrifice.

upright.description: Death signals a powerful transformation, marking the end of one phase and the beginning of another.

reversed.tags: Resistance to change, stagnation, fear of endings
reversed.description: Reversed, Death suggests an unwillingness to let go of the past, resulting in stagnation or missed opportunities for growth.

upright.description: Temperance encourages balance and the integration of opposites, guiding you toward harmony and moderation.

reversed.description: Reversed, Temperance warns of extremes or a lack of balance that disrupts harmony in your life.

upright.description: The Devil represents the chains of addiction, materialism, and unhealthy attachments that bind you.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Devil indicates the possibility of breaking free from negative patterns and regaining control.

upright.description: The Tower signals dramatic, sometimes disruptive change that, while unsettling, paves the way for transformation.

reversed.tags: Avoidance of disaster, fear of change, delayed upheaval
reversed.description: Reversed, The Tower may indicate a reluctance to face necessary change or a temporary delay in upheaval.

upright.description: The Star offers a beacon of hope and inspiration, guiding you toward inner peace and clarity.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Star suggests feelings of discouragement or disconnection from your inner light.

upright.description: The Moon invites you to explore your subconscious and confront hidden fears and uncertainties.

reversed.description: Reversed, The Moon warns of increased anxiety, misinterpretations, or deception clouding your judgment.

upright.description: The Sun radiates positivity, success, and vitality, symbolizing warmth and joyful energy.

reversed.tags: Temporary setbacks, lack of clarity, oversensitivity
reversed.description: Reversed, The Sun may suggest temporary obstacles or a dampening of the usual positive energy.

upright.description: Judgement calls for honest self-reflection and the opportunity to awaken to a new phase of life.

reversed.description: Reversed, Judgement warns of an unwillingness to face past actions or learn from previous mistakes.

upright.description: The World celebrates the successful completion of a cycle, marking fulfillment and wholeness.

reversed.tags: Incomplete tasks, delays, lack of closure
reversed.description: Reversed, The World indicates unfinished business or delays in reaching your full potential.

upright.description: The Ace of Cups signifies an overflow of emotions and the start of a new, heartfelt journey in love and creativity.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ace of Cups warns of emotional stagnation or an inability to fully embrace your creative or loving potential.

upright.description: The Two of Cups represents a deep and harmonious partnership, marked by mutual attraction and shared feelings.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Two of Cups suggests disharmony or an imbalance in a relationship, signaling potential disconnect.

upright.description: The Three of Cups celebrates friendship and community, highlighting the joy of shared experiences.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Three of Cups can indicate overindulgence or a feeling of exclusion within a social group.

upright.description: The Four of Cups invites introspection and reevaluation of emotional needs, urging you to consider what truly matters.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Four of Cups suggests a newfound openness to emotional opportunities and a release from apathy.

upright.description: The Five of Cups reflects on loss and regret, urging you to acknowledge sorrow while looking for what remains.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Five of Cups signals a turning point toward acceptance and the ability to move forward after loss.

upright.description: The Six of Cups evokes nostalgic memories and a longing for the innocence of childhood, suggesting healing through remembrance.

reversed.tags: Stuck in the past, unrealistic nostalgia
reversed.description: Reversed, the Six of Cups warns against clinging too tightly to the past, which can hinder personal growth.

upright.description: The Seven of Cups presents a variety of choices and possibilities, inviting you to discern between illusion and reality.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Seven of Cups cautions against confusion and the inability to make clear choices.

upright.description: The Eight of Cups signifies a voluntary departure from a situation that no longer serves you, urging emotional growth.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Eight of Cups warns that an unwillingness to let go may lead to stagnation and missed opportunities.

upright.description: The Nine of Cups is known as the wish card—it brings satisfaction and fulfillment, celebrating emotional contentment.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Nine of Cups can indicate that superficial fulfillment masks deeper dissatisfaction or greed.

upright.description: The Ten of Cups represents ultimate happiness and fulfillment in relationships and home life.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ten of Cups may signal disharmony within the family or unmet emotional expectations.

upright.description: The Page of Cups invites you to explore new creative ideas and emotional experiences with curiosity.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Page of Cups warns of an immature or overly naive approach to emotional matters.

upright.description: The Knight of Cups is a passionate and charismatic figure, urging you to follow your heart and creative impulses.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Knight of Cups suggests that overidealization or emotional instability might be clouding your judgment.

upright.description: The Queen of Cups embodies empathy and emotional understanding, offering comfort and nurturing energy.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Queen of Cups may indicate a tendency toward emotional manipulation or excessive sensitivity.

upright.description: The King of Cups rules with compassion and wisdom, balancing emotion with reason and offering generosity.

reversed.description: Reversed, the King of Cups might suggest difficulty in managing emotions, leading to moodiness or manipulation.

upright.description: The Ace of Pentacles symbolizes a promising new beginning in the realm of material or financial prosperity.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ace of Pentacles warns of lost opportunities or instability in your financial or material world.

upright.description: The Two of Pentacles shows that you are juggling responsibilities with adaptability and a sense of balance.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Two of Pentacles indicates struggles with managing multiple demands, leading to imbalance.

upright.description: The Three of Pentacles celebrates collaboration, craftsmanship, and the successful application of skills in a team setting.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Three of Pentacles may suggest challenges in working with others or ineffective planning.

upright.description: The Four of Pentacles reflects a strong desire for stability and control over your material world.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Four of Pentacles warns of an excessive focus on material security that can lead to isolation or greed.

upright.description: The Five of Pentacles often indicates a period of financial or material hardship, leaving you feeling isolated.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Five of Pentacles offers a sign of recovery and the possibility of finding help in difficult times.

upright.description: The Six of Pentacles represents the balance between giving and receiving, highlighting generosity and support.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Six of Pentacles warns of imbalances in give-and-take, possibly indicating selfishness or financial strain.

upright.description: The Seven of Pentacles encourages patience and steady investment, suggesting that your efforts will eventually yield rewards.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Seven of Pentacles may indicate impatience or frustration over slow progress, urging you to reassess your strategies.

upright.description: The Eight of Pentacles represents dedicated work and the mastery of a craft, emphasizing learning and refinement.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Eight of Pentacles warns of losing focus or burning out due to overwork without meaningful progress.

upright.description: The Nine of Pentacles celebrates the rewards of hard work, independence, and enjoying the fruits of your labor.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Nine of Pentacles may signal that material success is overshadowed by isolation or excess.

upright.description: The Ten of Pentacles represents the culmination of financial stability, legacy, and family security.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ten of Pentacles warns of disruptions in family or financial matters that undermine long-term security.

upright.description: The Page of Pentacles is a messenger of new opportunities and encourages you to study and harness your potential for success.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Page of Pentacles can indicate a lack of focus or premature actions that hinder your growth.

upright.description: The Knight of Pentacles embodies hard work, practicality, and persistence, urging you to stay steady on your path.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Knight of Pentacles may warn of becoming too rigid or even lazy, impeding progress.

upright.description: The Queen of Pentacles is a nurturing figure who combines practicality with a caring nature to create a secure environment.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Queen of Pentacles might indicate a focus on material matters to the detriment of emotional or personal care.

upright.description: The King of Pentacles represents success, financial security, and a commanding presence in the material realm.

reversed.description: Reversed, the King of Pentacles warns of mismanagement of resources or an overemphasis on material control.

upright.description: The Ace of Swords heralds a breakthrough in thought and clarity of vision, cutting through confusion to reveal truth.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ace of Swords warns of confusion or miscommunication, suggesting that clarity may be obstructed.

upright.description: The Two of Swords reflects a difficult decision or a stalemate in thought, urging you to seek clarity.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Two of Swords indicates a breakdown in decision-making, often leading to further confusion.

upright.description: The Three of Swords symbolizes deep emotional pain and heartbreak, urging acknowledgement and healing.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Three of Swords offers the promise of recovery and the potential to heal from past hurts.

upright.description: The Four of Swords invites a period of rest and contemplation, allowing for mental and physical recovery.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Four of Swords may indicate a reluctance to rest, leading to exhaustion or heightened stress.

upright.description: The Five of Swords reflects a situation of conflict and tension, where winning may come at too high a cost.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Five of Swords signals the potential for resolving conflicts through compromise and understanding.

upright.description: The Six of Swords represents a journey away from difficulty toward calmer waters—a rite of passage into a new phase.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Six of Swords suggests a reluctance to leave the past behind, resulting in lingering emotional turmoil.

upright.description: The Seven of Swords points to cunning strategy or hidden motives—either as a defense or a means of betrayal.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Seven of Swords suggests that deception will be exposed and urges accountability in your actions.

upright.description: The Eight of Swords depicts feeling trapped or restricted by your own fears and limitations.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Eight of Swords signals the breaking of mental bonds and a newfound sense of freedom.

upright.description: The Nine of Swords is a card of anxiety and distress, often reflecting worries that keep you up at night.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Nine of Swords suggests that you are beginning to confront and overcome your deepest anxieties.

upright.description: The Ten of Swords signals the absolute end of a cycle, often accompanied by pain or a sense of betrayal.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ten of Swords offers the promise of regeneration and the opportunity to rebuild after a collapse.

upright.description: The Page of Swords is energetic and curious, eager to learn and communicate ideas with a sharp mind.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Page of Swords warns of rash words or a tendency to be overly defensive in communication.

upright.description: The Knight of Swords charges forward with determination and focus, ready to pursue his goals with energy.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Knight of Swords can indicate rash actions without thought, resulting in mistakes or setbacks.

upright.description: The Queen of Swords is known for her sharp intellect, independence, and clear perception of the truth.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Queen of Swords may indicate a tendency toward harshness or a misinterpretation of the facts.

upright.description: The King of Swords embodies intellectual authority, discipline, and a commitment to truth and fairness.

reversed.description: Reversed, the King of Swords warns of using power in a dictatorial way or being overly rigid in your judgments.

upright.description: The Ace of Wands heralds the spark of inspiration and the start of a creative or energetic new venture.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ace of Wands warns of a blockage in creative energy or delays in launching new projects.

upright.description: The Two of Wands urges you to plan carefully and consider your options as you prepare for future expansion.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Two of Wands suggests a difficulty in making decisions or moving forward due to fear or uncertainty.

upright.description: The Three of Wands symbolizes the early stages of growth and expansion, encouraging you to look ahead and seize opportunities.

reversed.tags: Delay, missed opportunity, lack of foresight
reversed.description: Reversed, the Three of Wands warns of delays or missed opportunities due to a lack of planning or vision.

upright.description: The Four of Wands is a card of celebration and stability, marking milestones and the joy of shared success.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Four of Wands may indicate that celebrations are delayed or that there is tension disrupting harmony.

upright.description: The Five of Wands highlights healthy competition and minor conflicts that spark growth through challenge.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Five of Wands suggests that conflict has escalated into discord or chaos, hindering progress.

upright.description: The Six of Wands is a card of triumph, celebrating success and public recognition for your achievements.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Six of Wands may indicate that success is elusive or that pride and ego are getting in the way.

upright.description: The Seven of Wands calls on you to stand your ground and defend your position against opposition.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Seven of Wands warns that you may be giving in too easily or feeling overwhelmed by opposition.

upright.description: The Eight of Wands signifies rapid movement and swift progress, with events unfolding quickly.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Eight of Wands indicates that anticipated progress may be delayed, leading to frustration.

upright.description: The Nine of Wands stands for resilience and the courage to keep fighting, even when faced with challenges.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Nine of Wands warns that you may be overly defensive or exhausted from constant battles.

upright.description: The Ten of Wands indicates that you are carrying a heavy load or many responsibilities that require hard work.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Ten of Wands offers the possibility of releasing burdens by delegating tasks or letting go of excessive responsibility.

upright.description: The Page of Wands embodies youthful enthusiasm and the spirit of exploration, urging you to try new ventures.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Page of Wands warns of impulsiveness or a lack of clear direction in pursuing your goals.

upright.description: The Knight of Wands charges forward with vibrant energy and a thirst for adventure, inspiring bold action.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Knight of Wands may signal impulsive behavior or a lack of follow-through on your adventurous ideas.

upright.description: The Queen of Wands exudes warmth, confidence, and determination, empowering you to pursue your ambitions.

reversed.description: Reversed, the Queen of Wands may indicate an overbearing attitude or volatile emotions that hinder progress.

upright.description: The King of Wands represents visionary leadership and the ability to inspire others with his dynamic energy.

reversed.description: Reversed, the King of Wands warns of uncontrolled ambition or dictatorial behavior that undermines true leadership.
